1.name: Justyna Kot
1.shortBio: Blogger, geek girl, coffee lover, GDG Rzeszów co-founder and community manager
1.bio: In brief: blogger, geek girl, coffee lover, GDG Rzeszów co-founder and community manager.  Justyna is a visual communication and digital marketing specialist (especially brands strategy, content creation, growth hacking and web analytics). Really passionate about new technologies, social media trends and world of digital influencers.

2.name: Oleh Zasadnyy
2.shortBio: Oleh is a front-end developer who is passionate by new technologies and design
2.bio: Oleh is a front-end developer who is passionate by new technologies and design. He also is a GDG Lviv organizer last 5 years, which is famous for their high-level organized conferences. Besides that, he participates in GDG design competitions and always in the top three. Oleh has created several front-end Open Source projects. The most popular are event website templates, one of them you are looking at.

3.name: Kseniia Shumelchyk
3.shortBio: GDG Dnipro and WTM Ukraine lead. Anita Borg schoolarship winner
3.bio: Kseniia is working as Senior Software Engineer at SoftServe as well she has an experience of working on open-source project during Google Summer of Code. Kseniia is leading Women Techmakers Ukraine and GDG Dnipro communities for 4 years. She participated in number of international conferences: GOTO Aarhus, Google I/O and GDG Leaders Summit and was a speaker at Droidcon Berlin, Women Techmakers Istanbul, GDG DevFest Ukraine, Codemotion Milan and Droidcon Krakow. In 2015 Kseniia was selected as recipient of Google Anita Borg Scholarship that aimed to support women with outstanding results in Computer Science. Kseniia is a big fan of innovative technologies in education and software development. She is creator of Android application for Women Techmakers Community.

4.name: Vitaliy Zasadnyy
4.shortBio: Developer. Public Speaker. Community manager. Co-founder of GDG Lviv
4.bio: Vitaliy is a mobile developer, public speaker and community manager. He is eager about product perfection and scalability. Goes crazy about new IoT devices and Google products. Originally Vitaliy is from Ukraine, where he founded GDG Lviv. Now he is leading mobile department at GetSocial, startup based in The Netherlands. GetSocial is building the cloud-based mobile engagement platform that empowers any app developer with tools to maximise user acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization.

5.name: Anna Kurylo
5.shortBio: Anna is a front-end developer passionate about Angular 2
5.bio: Anna is a front-end developer passionate about Angular 2. She is a co-Organizer of GDG Kyiv-Center, and also a Women Techmakers Kyiv Lead. Loves traveling and doing all kinds of cool things :)

6.name: Alexey Buzdin
6.shortBio: Alexey is a passionate developer and trainer that is into cross-platform mobile tech
6.bio: Alexey is a passionate developer and trainer that is into cross-platform mobile tech. He is always looking forward to talk about various technologies, technical challenges and share his opinion about them. High chance that you can see him speaking or stalking in pretty much all developers communities in Riga, Latvia. In addition he is also an organizer of Google Developers Group Riga (gdgriga.lv) that hosts monthly meetups about IT and tech and annual Riga Dev Day conference (http://rigadevday.lv/).

7.name: Constantine Mars
7.shortBio: Constantine is Senior Developer at DataArt and Organizer of GDG Dnipro
7.bio: Constantine is Senior Developer at DataArt and Organizer of GDG Dnipro. He is passionate about wearables, especially Android Wear, and loves to talk about functional reactive programming, Java 8, RxJava, Dagger2. In free time he participates in life of Java User Group Dnipro or just goes to run outdoor and test new fitness applications for the wear.

8.name: Piotr Olesinski
8.shortBio: Piotr is Product Manager in Yieldplanet (hotel software company)
8.bio: Piotr is Product Manager in Yieldplanet (hotel software company). Previously worked in sales and business development as well as in engineering and business consulting and on own projects. Organiser of Google Developers Group, kayaker and casual traveler.

9.name: Milan Lempera
9.shortBio: Milan is  Angular, JavaScript and testing trainer, freelance developer and clean code lover
9.bio: Milan is  Angular, JavaScript and testing trainer, freelance developer and clean code lover. Also an Organizer of Google Developers Group Jihlava, Czech Republic.

10.name: Leoš Přikryl
10.shortBio: Leoš is a freelance developer interested mostly in Java, JavaScript, AngularJS and Android
10.bio: Leoš is a freelance developer interested mostly in Java, JavaScript, AngularJS and Android. Also an Organizer of Google Developers Group Jihlava, Czech Republic, trying to support IT companies in our region, so local talents don't have to leave for big cities.

11.name: Jakub Kolakowski
11.shortBio: GDG Warsaw Manager and one of 5 people who started GDG movement in Poland in 2011
11.bio: GDG Warsaw Manager and one of 5 people who started GDG movement in Poland in 2011. Not a developer (yet, if something has to be done...), PM and process focused.

12.name: Honza Slavík
12.shortBio: Honza is professional Jedi Knight. His work is care about balance of power at galaxy and czech companies
12.bio: Honza is professional Jedi Knight. His work is care about balance of power at galaxy and czech companies. Do not try to understand me. You could go crazy over it. ;)

14.name: Volodymyr Ivanov
14.shortBio: Founder and coordinator of the first Google Developer Group in Ukraine - GDG Kyiv-Center (since 2009)
14.bio: Founder and coordinator of the first Google Developer Group in Ukraine - GDG Kyiv-Center (since 2009). Community manager аnd a prominent member of the Ukrainian and international GDG communities, organizer of the first Ukrainian Hackathon, initiator and co-organizer of first DevFests Ukraine 2012-13.

13.name: Sergey Kibish
13.shortBio: Sergey is a Software Developer at Transact Pro (Fintech company) and GDG Riga (Latvia) Co-organiser
13.bio: Sergey is a Software Developer at Transact Pro (Fintech company) and GDG Riga (Latvia) Co-organiser. Pretending for a Master degree in Computer Science. Can't sit still and don’t do something for a long time. Love different technology and make useful things with it. When there is a spare time - plays piano or drums. Don’t be afraid to ask questions.

16.name: Adam Malczak
16.bio: Works as a Policy Analyst at Google covering Central and Eastern Europe. He is responsible for cooperation in the New Europe 100 project. Graduate of King’s College London and London School of Economics and Political Science.
